newsitem.title: CANADA: Bre-X to resume trading at 1030 EST.
newsitem.headline: Bre-X to resume trading at 1030 EST.

text.p: Bre-X Minerals Ltd shares will resume trading today at 1030 EST/1530 GMT, the Toronto Stock Exchange said on Tuesday.
Bre-X had not yet filed an expected news release containing "material" information with the TSE surveillance department, exchange officials said.
Bre-X stock trading was halted all day Monday in Toronto and on Nasdaq.
Nasdaq said it would also resume the stock at 1030 EST/1530 GMT.
"The company has not yet issued a news release, as it undertook to do yesterday, and it is inappropriate to further delay the resumption of trading," the TSE said in a statement.
"The exchange reaffirms its commitment to provide a fair and continuous market in its listing securities for shareholders and investors," it added.
After Bre-X issued a release on Monday, the TSE said trading in Bre-X would start trading again this morning after dissemination of additional news.

"The company said new material information will be available from a report by (assay company) Kilborn and has undertaken to issue a news release before the opening of the market (Tuesday)," the TSE said on Tuesday.
Bre-X closed last Thursday at 2.50, down 13 from last Tuesday's close.
